TRAILERS

by
December 3, 2024
Source: YouTube

"You cannot understand the damage you've done." Vertical has revealed an official trailer for an indie film called Mind Wave, a tech conspiracy thriller from Chinese-Canadian filmmaker Leon Lee. Set for a VOD release later this week - ready to watch right away if you're intrigued. As a global ban looms over a popular Chinese app (in real life - TikTok - though they give it a fake name in here), a framed expatriate cyber expert races to clear his name and expose a conspiracy threatening democracy worldwide. He races against time to find out exactly what is going on; his wife mysteriously vanishes, leaving behind a trail of cryptic clues that point to a deeper conspiracy. Starring Harry Han as Clint Wu, with Liz Cha, Steve Thackray, Ian Kim, and James Lew. This seems to be trying to comment on current events, but looks a bit too cheesy and a bit too obsessed with conspiracies to actually shake up anything in the real world. But still worth a look anyway.

Here's the official trailer (+ poster) for Leon Lee's thriller Mind Wave, direct from YouTube:

A Chinese-Canadian cybersecurity expert (starring Harry Han) is wrongfully accused of a devastating attack on China's internet. As he fights to clear his name, his wife mysteriously vanishes, leaving behind a trail of cryptic clues that point to a deeper conspiracy. Mind Wave is directed by the Chinese-Canadian filmmaker Leon Lee, director of the films Human Harvest, The Bleeding Edge, Avenues of Escape, Letter from Masanjia, Room 0533, and Unsilenced previously. The screenplay is written by Michael Fine and Leon Lee. It's also produced by Leon Lee; co-produced by Jacey Shi and Matt Villeneuve. This hasn't premiered at any film festivals or elsewhere, as far as we know. Flying Cloud / Vertical will debut Leon Lee's Mind Wave film direct-to-VOD to watch starting on December 6th, 2024 this month. Anyone curious about this one?
